subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Files From Sound Soap Today
author: Stefan Bion
full_text:
Hi Steve,

I have to admit that I've had problems to hear the same as you did - but
perhaps this is a matter of language. Some I heard different, e.g.
instead of "here_it's_tough", I heard "urkel gets some doubt". :)

But nevertheless, I think this is an interesting method, since it
involves the experimenter into the EVP creation process.

Stefan

-- 


> I figured i would do an introduction for those who don't know about the 
> program.  Sound Soap is a manual tuning method to an audio file.  It 
> has a bar on the bottom that can be manually moved by the user with the 
> mouse.  What i did today was experiment with Stefan's Allophone file 
> into the Sound Soap program and manual sweep the audible tones.  I 
> think this may be the best files i ever got so far, please listen and 
> let me know what you guys think.  These files were from a 3 min. 
> session with minimal editing.  I've had this program for months and 
> never used it, i think Bruce gave it to me.

> -Steve H.
